news_header: Sanoma reported a seasonal operational loss for Q4 2023, with net sales of EUR 253.4 million and an operating loss of EUR 27.0 million. The company aims for improved profitability through its Solar program.
news_text: Sanoma, a provider of media and learning services, released its interim report for October-December 2023, showing net sales of EUR 253.4 million and an operational loss of EUR 27.0 million. The company traditionally experiences losses in this period due to the seasonal nature of learning services. Analysts had forecasted lower sales and higher losses. The media sector saw a decline in TV and print advertising sales, while order sales grew. The Board proposed a dividend of EUR 0.39 per share. Looking ahead, Sanoma projects revenue of EUR 1.28-1.33 billion and operational profit of EUR 170-190 million for 2025. The Managing Director noted improvements in profitability and cash flow, attributing success to the Solar program aimed at enhancing learning services profitability to 23% by 2026.
